item.title: Card Battling RPG Sultan's Game Sells 100k Copies in Just 48 Hours
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/sultans-game-100k-sales-48-hours

Developer Double Cross Studio and publisher 2P Games have announced that card-based RPG Sultan's Game has crossed a pretty big sales milestone within its first couple of days on release.

Per a press release, Sultan's Game crossed 100,000 sales within 48 hours, which puts it on par with the likes of survival-crafter Soulmask and underground indie explore-'em-up Core Keeper.

By way of a celebration for the sales milestone, Double Cross has revealed some of its plans for Sultan's Game in the next couple of months, which include a new epilogue, extra story stuff, and support for Steam Workshop to allow players to create their own mods.

Other upcoming improvements include a new Quick Execution system, which will allow you to manage your estate and sit through court sessions more quickly. You don't have to switch this on if you prefer to sit these events through, though.

You'll also soon be able to assign card categories to certain hand slots, and you'll be able to set hotkeys to automatically organize your card collection too, which should make it a little easier to sift through your deck.

In addition, Double Cross says it's looking to "fine-tune disruptive sound effects and musical transitions", and a new sensitive content warning toggle will be added to allow you to decide whether you want to be warned about "sensitive storylines" or not.

As well as all of this, a manual save-load system is coming, along with controller and Steam Deck optimization, a new gallery mode for cards and endings, and lots more. Suffice it to say Double Cross and 2P are in it for the long haul when it comes to Sultan's Game.

If you've yet to check out Sultan's Game, you can pick it up right now on PC via Steam, where it'll currently set you back $22.49 (although it's usually $24.99).
